intro: Psychotria puyoana, commonly known as the Puyo psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Psychotria puyoana is also noted for its chemical compounds, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
